intro: Wercklea grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered wercklea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
